answers.answer: Hello Tammy304,We're all volunteers here and not medical professionals.  We're very experienced personally with Type 1 diabetes, also.I have found a resource (see below) for scientific articles on pediatric functional constipation.  It seems that there can be a few causes adn there are some treatments that include laxatives; fiber-rich foods and lots of water; and also behavioral training & encouragement.  Apparently, your daughter is not alone in suffering from this condition.Since you are concerned about diabetes, it is not unreasonable to have her tested and to watch for classic symptoms.  While "stooly" mouth odor is not a classic symptom, a fruity mouth odor can be.  I've included a reference to Mayo clinic website on diabetes symptoms and a reference to Joslin Diabetes Center website with information about diabetes more generallyDIABETES SYMPTOMS/ RELATED ARTICLES:http://www.mayoclinic.com/health/type-1-diabetes/DS00329/DSECTION=2DIABETEShttp://www.joslin.org/RESOURCE Enter this website, then type in "pediatric functional constipation" (without the quotation marks) for a searchhttp://www.sciencedirect.com/scienceI hope this is helpful

title: diabities and constipation???
